para.text: Version 5.3
Added the ability to import MODFLOW 6 models.
Added a new "Active Specified Head" field that allows the user to make some specified head boundaries active or inactive based on a formula.
Added a new "Specified Concentration Active" and "Mass Loading Active" fields that allows the user to make some Constant Concentration and Mass Loading cells active or inactive based on a formula.
The scale factor for a dynamic time series can now be a formula.
ModelMuse now checks that PEST Observation Group names and Prior Information Group names are assigned.
ModelMuse now supports the AUXMULTNAME option in MODFLOW 6.
ModelMuse can now plot results from the MT3D Transport Observation package.

In the MODFLOW 6 lake package, lakes that only have vertical connections are now treated as having vertical connections to the layer in which the lake object occurs instead of to the layer below the lake object. Lakes that have both horizontal and vertical connections are evaluated in the same as in previous versions of ModelMuse.
In the MNW2 package, ZTOP and ZBOTM are now exported with slightly different values to ensure that MNW2 wells are not connected to the wrong layers. This change compensates for a bug in MODFLOW-2005.

The extension of the binary file generated by the MT3D Transport Observation file containing the calculated concentrations and mass fluxes at user defined observation points and mass-flux objects has been changed from .pst to ._pst to avoid conflicts with PEST.
Fixed a bug editing formulas that could cause the formula to be specified incorrectly.
Fixed a bug that could cause an access violation when shutting down ModelMuse while the Show or Hide Objects dialog box is displayed.
Fixed a bug that could cause access violations when editing objects while the Show or Hide Objects dialog box is displayed and Calibration data sets have been defined.
Fixed bug that can cause an access violation when shutting down ModelMuse.
Fixed a bug in the display of objects with one elevation formula in the front and side views.
Fixed bug opening MODFLOW 6 model with ETS package.
Fixed a bug in the MVR package, in which the FACTOR was divided among UZF reciver cells even that option was not selected.
Fixed bug in MVR package in which the flow could be directed to the wrong SFR receiver if more than one SFR receiver was used with the same MVR source.
Fixed bug that causes an assertion failure when using pilot points with data sets that do not have values at every cell.
Fixed bug in the display of data from the TVK and TVS packages so that the data is now displayed on the correct layer.
Fixed bug in exporting the DIS input file for MODFLOW-OWHM version 2 when the Farm package is not selected.
Fixed bug in assigning properties to SUTRA nodes with objects that should intersect the cell around nodes.
Using lake tables with lakes didn't work if PEST was active.
With MODPATH 7, extra values were previously included with the particle locations.
Fixed export of budget CSV file with the UZT package.
Fixed bug in exporting MAW and UZF package input files in MODFLOW 6 when observations have been defined but the observation utility is not active.
Fixed export of RCH package in MODFLOW 6 when objects are to be summed.
Fixed export of h0 in CSUB package data.
Fixed export of MVR when the source doesn't change over time.
Fixed export of some flow boundary packages when the only change between stress periods was the boundary concentration in the transport package.
Fixed reading some ModelMuse files on systems that us comma as the decimal separator.
Fixed export of GWT DSP file that would cause an assertion failure.
The EVT package is now included in the MODFLOW 6 grounddwater transport source and sink mixing package as an AUXMIXED source.
Fixed export of SFR package for MODFLOW 6 after disabling solute transport.
Fixed bug in exporting groundwater allotments in MODFLOW-owhm version 2.
Fixed export of SFR, SFT, MAW, MWT, LAK, LKT, UZF, and UZT packages when both the flow package and the associated transport package used time-series files.
Editing an object no longer causes the Boundary to be recalculated just becaue the Object Properties dialog box has been displayed.
Fixed interpolation in display of time series values.
Fixed export of concentration observations when some concentration observations are used for parameter estimation and some are not.
